description: Largest integer power of n which divides product of divisors of n.
links: Index entries for two-way infinite sequences
formula: a(n) =n^A056924(n). If n is a square a(n)=A007955(n)/sqrt(n), otherwise a(n)=A007955(n)
example: a(16)=256 since the factors of 16 are 1,2,4,8,16, their product is 1024 and the largest power of 16 which divides 1024 is 256
mathematica: lip[n_]:=Module[{pr=Times@@Divisors[n],pwr},pwr= Floor[ Log[n,pr]]; n^Last[Select[Range[pwr],Divisible[pr,n^#]&]]]; Join[{1},lip/@ Range[2,50]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 02 2011 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 12 2000
